summary: High-priority planned ship and submarine maintenance happens pier-side in homeports, allowing the Navy to interrupt repairs and get ships underway quickly if needed. These "intermediate maintenance periods" are critical to fleet readiness, but the Navy generally doesn't collect or analyze sufficient data to monitor or improve them. title: Navy Ship Maintenance: Actions Needed to Monitor and Address the Performance of Intermediate Maintenance Periods
